Package nzilbb.ag.serialize.json

Class JSONSerialization

  • java.lang.Object
    • nzilbb.ag.serialize.json.JSONSerialization
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GraphSerializer
    public class JSONSerialization
extends Object
implements GraphSerializer
    Annotation Graph serializer/deserializer for JSON.
    Author:
    Robert Fromont robert@fromont.net.nz

      • configure

        public ParameterSet configure​(ParameterSet configuration,
                              Schema schema)
        Sets parameters for serializer as a whole. This might include database connection parameters, locations of supporting files, standard layer mappings, etc.

        When the serializer is installed, this method should be invoked with an empty parameter set, to discover what (if any) general configuration is required. If parameters are returned, and user interaction is possible, then the user may be presented with an interface for setting/confirming these parameters.

        GraphSerializer and IDeserializer method.

        Specified by:
        configure in interface GraphSerializer
        Parameters:
        configuration - The general configuration for the serializer.
        schema - The layer schema, definining layers and the way they interrelate.
        Returns:
        A list of configuration parameters (still) must be set before GraphSerializer.getRequiredLayers() can be called. If this is an empty list, GraphSerializer.getRequiredLayers() can be called. If it's not an empty list, this method must be invoked again with the returned parameters' values set.

      • load

        public ParameterSet load​(NamedStream[] streams,
                         Schema schema)
                  throws IOException,
                         SerializationException,
                         SerializerNotConfiguredException
        Loads the serialized form of the graph, using the given set of named streams.

        IDeserializer method.

        Parameters:
        streams - A list of named streams that contain all the transcription/annotation data required.
        schema - The layer schema, definining layers and the way they interrelate.
        Returns:
        A list of parameters that require setting before GraphDeserializer.deserialize() can be invoked. This may be an empty list, and may include parameters with the value already set to a workable default. If there are parameters, and user interaction is possible, then the user may be presented with an interface for setting/confirming these parameters, before they are then passed to GraphDeserializer.setParameters(ParameterSet).
        Throws:
        SerializationException - If the graph could not be loaded.
        IOException - On IO error.
        SerializerNotConfiguredException - If the configuration is not sufficient for deserialization.

      • setParameters

        public void setParameters​(ParameterSet parameters)
                   throws SerializationParametersMissingException
        Sets parameters for a given deserialization operation, after loading the serialized form of the graph. This might include mappings from format-specific objects like tiers to graph layers, etc.

        IDeserializer method.

        Parameters:
        parameters - The configuration for a given deserialization operation.
        Throws:
        SerializationParametersMissingException - If not all required parameters have a value.

      • deserialize

        public Graph[] deserialize()
                    throws SerializerNotConfiguredException,
                           SerializationParametersMissingException,
                           SerializationException
        Deserializes the serialized data, generating one or more Graphs.

        Many data formats will only yield one graph (e.g. Transcriber transcript or Praat textgrid), however there are formats that are capable of storing multiple transcripts in the same file (e.g. AGTK, Transana XML export), which is why this method returns a list.

        IDeserializer method.

        Returns:
        A list of valid (if incomplete) Graphs.
        Throws:
        SerializerNotConfiguredException - if the object has not been configured.
        SerializationParametersMissingException - if the parameters for this particular graph have not been set.
        SerializationException - if errors occur during deserialization.

      • getRequiredLayers

        public String[] getRequiredLayers()
                           throws SerializationParametersMissingException
        Determines which layers, if any, must be present in the graph that will be serialized.

        GraphSerializer method.

        Specified by:
        getRequiredLayers in interface GraphSerializer
        Returns:
        An empty array, as no particular layers are required.
        Throws:
        SerializationParametersMissingException - If not all required parameters have a value.

      • getCardinality

        public GraphSerializer.Cardinality getCardinality()
        Determines the cardinality between graphs and serialized streams.
        Specified by:
        getCardinality in interface GraphSerializer
        Returns:
        GraphSerializer.Cardinality.NtoN as there is one stream produced per graph.

      • serialize

        public void serialize​(Spliterator<Graph> graphs,
                      String[] layerIds,
                      Consumer<NamedStream> consumer,
                      Consumer<String> warnings,
                      Consumer<SerializationException> errors)
               throws SerializerNotConfiguredException
        Serializes the given graph, generating one or more NamedStreams.

        Many data formats will only yield one stream (e.g. Transcriber transcript or Praat textgrid), however there are formats that use multiple files for the same transcript (e.g. XWaves, EmuR), which is why this method returns a list. There are formats that are capable of storing multiple transcripts in the same file (e.g. AGTK, Transana XML export), which is why this method accepts a list.

        Specified by:
        serialize in interface GraphSerializer
        Parameters:
        graphs - The graphs to serialize.
        layerIds - The IDs of the layers to include, or null for all layers.
        consumer - The object receiving the streams.
        warnings - The object receiving warning messages.
        errors - A consumer for (fatal) error messages.
        Throws:
        SerializerNotConfiguredException - if the object has not been configured.
